in a Michael Government white paper, the baccalaureate was brought in by education Secretary Michael Gove as a means of measuring a school's success in` tougher' subjects. Terry Molloy , headteacher at Claremont, said: We are delighted that despite the English Baccalaureate being a retrospective measure, our school has achieved at more than twice the national average. "We will ensure that we look at what changes might be needed to our curriculum to deliver the best possible education for our students, to improve their life chances and those of the communities we serve. Claremont scored the second best GCSE results in Brent, behind the prestigious Jewish Free School in The Mall, Kingsbury, where half its pupils achieved the English Baccalaureate and 88 per cent scored five A*
